name: Almond Beach Resort

reviews.title: Perfect for honeymooners!
reviews.text: We have just returned from an amazing week at Almond Beach Resort! We knew we wanted to go to Belize for our honeymoon, but had a difficult time deciding where to go. We are an active couple, and really wanted some adventure on our trip. We didn't want to party, and wanted to avoid a really touristy location. Almond Beach satisfied everything we wanted from our honeymoon.

reviews.title: Amazing stay! Can not say enough good things!
reviews.text: We really enjoyed the fact that there were many other honeymooners staying at Almond Beach/Jaguar Reef (the resorts are under the same management and share dining facilities). We got to spend our days going on tours with other couples, and often joined them for dinner at night. We were happy because there weren't many children there, either. The resort seems to attract more couples than families, and we liked that.

reviews.title: Mix of Extremes
reviews.text: The tours were absolutely amazing. We loved the new Actun Tunichil Muknal (ATM) Cave tour. It was challenging, but extremely educational and fun. Another favorite was the Mayflower Waterfall tour. It was a slightly difficult hike, and had an absolutely gorgeous view of Belize from the top. Of course, snorkeling and diving were great, too. I’d steer clear of the horseback riding tour. The horses weren’t well-trained, and you can see the jungle on many of the other trips.

reviews.title: Adventurous Yet Relaxing
reviews.text: One caution—bring plenty of bug spray. The times we forgot to use it, we were sorry. I did some research and found out that Avon’s “Skin So Soft” plus bug guard worked well against sand flies. The aerosol spray and the sunscreen plus bug guard were a lifesaver. I’d also bring some Hydrocortisone just in case you get bit.

reviews.title: Almond Beach is an Incredible Vacation Destination
reviews.text: The food at the resort is pretty good. If you get the all-inclusive package you will have way more than enough to eat. The local choices on the menu were fantastic. Dinners were the best meal of the day—tons of food, but tasty choices and great desserts.

reviews.title: Highly Recommended stay at Almond Beach
reviews.text: We've just returned from a week's stay at the Almond Beach Resort which is a sister property to the Jaguar Reef. Having never visited Belize before, we were unsure what to expect. The entire experience was a positive one (other than missing a day due to a flight delay in Dallas.) The staff is so friendly and the accomodations were even better than they appeared on the website. The ocean there is the beautiful Caribbean blue that you hope for and the water temperature was 81 degrees - usually still in the morning and the wind picks up in the afternoons. We had a huge flat screen t.v. in our room which was handy for DVD movies after dark and the housekeeping services made daily visits with loads of clean towels and fresh flowers. The meals were wonderful and the fresh, locally grown o.j. in the mornings along with the individually cooked omlettes are highly recommended. We took two of the excursions offered - snorkeling the Barrier Reef and Zip Lining/Cave Tubing -- both of which were well organized and really fun for the four of us, two adults and our daughters ages 14 and 12. You won't be disappointed at the Almond Beach Resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from Almond beach where we spent our honeymoon from March 10th to 16th. We would highly recommend the resort but it is not for everybody.
reviews.title: A great honeymoon

reviews.text: First of all, what is the difference between Jaguar Reef and Almond Beach. Nothing really, same owners, same shared facilities, same staff, same restaurant, same management. The Almond Beach section is somewhat newer as it is only 2 years old and from what we were told the rooms are nicer than at the Jaguar Reef.
reviews.title: Great Vacation Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Beachfront Casita called Guava. It was one of the nicest rooms we have ever stayed in. Of the 4 beachfront Casita's I would recommend Guava the most as the outdoor shower has a view of the ocean and it is not directly beside the pool. The casita has a massive bathroom, very comfy bed and a lovely porch for sitting on. It really is only 20 steps or so away from the water.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon Destination

likes.liked: — Very clean. High attention the detail. Very pleasant staff. Personal attention.
likes.disliked: — Furthest building from the restaurant and front desk. But, still very close. Would have liked a phone to call the front desk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort if VERY laid back. Relaxing is the main draw, if you are looking for a place with an "activity staff" you won't find it here. Getting a cabana on the beach is simple, none of that stupid putting your towels on the lounger at 6 am to reserve them. If you want to use a kayak or sailboat, you just do, no reserving it, no deposit or time restrictions, just bring it back when you are done. That being said, it would be nice if there were a few more things to do on the beach during the day, like a volleyball net or bocce ball.
reviews.title: We will return!!

reviews.text: the staff was sooo friendly, but needs more polishing and training. they just weren't up to snuff, but were so willing to please.
reviews.title: almost great, but needs some work

reviews.text: the food was ok, always out of something on the menu, but charming about it. i think if an owner was always around, things would quickly improve. after staying at chaa creek, i would advise the staff to model themselves after that hotel. very comfortable rooms and beds with lots of space.
reviews.title: Belize it or not , you are going to have a fabulous time!!

likes.liked: — How beautiful and roomy it was!
likes.disliked: — That I had to leave it and go home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit to this wonderful resort. We came last year and loved it so much, that we rebooked at the end of the stay.
reviews.title: Hidden Treasure in Belize

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This year we stayed in the lux Vista Suite. We were traveling with our 4 best friends. We had plenty of room and privacy. There is a full kitchen. We only made coffee and used the fridge for cokes and beer. Had the pleasure of having our dinner prepared twice in our home by Chef Christian. Loved both! Also enjoyed 2 dinners at nearby restaurants..Beaches and Dreams has Key Lime pie to die for! Lovely deck overlooking the ocean, nothing blocks the view. Each room had own ensuite with spa tub.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: Went to Spa 3 times..loved it, so did our traveling companions.
reviews.title: Great family beach/adventure vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Jaguar Reef from 8/20 to 8/27 and we were extremely happy with the resort. We were so sad to leave!
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon, Hands Down

likes.liked: — very quiet; provided great oppotunity to spend quality time with significant other

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To get there, we flew into belize city (goldson airport) and took a 17 minute trip in a small plane to a smaller airport, and from there we took a 20 minute, bumpy drive to the resort.
reviews.title: Awesome Vacation

likes.liked: — You can relax or go all out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Beachfront Casita, which certainly lives up to its name. We were about 25 feet from the water's edge with our own thatch umbrella and lounge chairs in front of us. There's a nice porch to sit and read on. The bed was large and so was the bathroom, which also had a a very large walk in shower. The room was kept spotless every day by the maids.
reviews.title: Fantastic vacation

likes.liked: — Friendliness of the staff, variety of tours, location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a list of activities and what days they are offered on. The Honeymoon package includes 3 full day trips. We took part in the Cayo Mayan Ruins, Ziplining/Cave Tubing and Snorkeling tours. Each one was fantastic. Our chaperones on each trip were very friendly and were very knowledgable about the particular place we were traveling to. Keep in mind that some "land" excursions (such as the mayan ruins) require a 2 hour van trip where you get to see the surrounding areas. The roads are not always paved and we sort of flew down these roads, so bring dramamine if you get carsick. Our boat trip to the barrier reef was about 30 min. In summary, the mayan ruins were excellent (not a pile of rubble), ziplining was very fun, and we got to see a lot of neat fish while snorkeling.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon!

likes.disliked: — Occasional mosquitos but that's to be expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the resort suprised us; it was better than we thought. Breakfast offers a small buffet with made to order omelets, waffle iron, and the usual bacon and potatoes in sterno-heated containers. There are those little boxes of cereal, but they seemed to be stale and the milk tasted funny, so I stuck to the eggs. There were a ton of flies buzzing around the table, but everything is covered well. Lunch is the same menu every day with different types of "standard" sandwiches and flatbread pizzas. At dinner, they put linen and hurricane lamps on the tables so it's a little more formal. They have different specials every night. The food isn't exotic. I had pork chops, fettucine alfredo, jerk chicken, etc. All of the food was excellent and the presentation was great too. You get bread and butter, and dont be surprised that the butter comes pretty soupy in a little bowl; it's perfectly fine. There is a golden retriever and a cat that wanders around the dining area, looking for attention and scraps.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

description: Awarded Hotel of the Year in 2010, our superb beach location with custom designed rooms providing more than 20 different choices, from honeymoon casitas to family suites, wonderful private wedding locations and a long golden beach that stretches for miles. Our guests say our biggest treasures are our warm and friendly staff, and our superb guides who will take you to explore the reef and Cockscombe basin Jaguar Preserve, plus Mayan and Garifuna cultures.
